author: Chris Waugh
title: Newcastle's Ayoze Perez responds to transfer speculation - and comments on Brexit
text:
Ayoze Perez has been linked with four Premier League sides, while the Newcastle United forward has also been asked about 'Brexit' Shares Get Newcastle United FC news by email 2016 Newcastle United Ayoze Perez during the Newcastle United training session 
Ayoze Perez insists he is “preparing to return” to his best with Newcastle United despite reports linking the forward with four Premier League sides. 
The 22-year-old signed a new contract through until 2021 in January and he is determined to help the Magpies back into the top flight, having been a part of the side who were relegated to the Championship. 
Manchester City, Arsenal, Everton and long-term admirers Tottenham Hotspur have all been credited with an interest in the forward in recent days, but Perez appears keen to be a part of Rafa Benitez’s Newcastle revolution. 
Asked about his future by Spanish publication El Dia the forward explained: “I have a contract [with Newcastle] until 2021, I was part of the relegation and I am preparing to return my best. 
“It was not a good year collectively or individually, but I scored some goals. 
“You have to take the positives and think about what’s coming. 
“It’s going to be tough but in your career, a player must always jump over obstacles.” 
The Spaniard - who was appearing at a football clinic for children in Tenerife along with his brother Sammy, who plays for Team Northumbria - has also revealed he has not had time to digest the next that Britain will leave the European Union. 
Post-Brexit, Perez would have been one of the nine current Magpies who United would have likely been unable to sign. 
Under current employment rules, any player with an EU passport is free to play in the UK without restriction, while those from outside Europe must meet specific Home Office criteria which depends on how many international appearances they have made and where their country sits in the FIFA rankings. 
That EU legislation allowed United to snap up Perez for just £1.5million from Tenerife two summers ago. 
Asked about Britain’s decision to leave the EU and how it could impact on his career, Perez replied: “I heard about, I have received some news about it, but being here on my vacation, it is not the time to dwell on that matter. 
“What has to happen will happen. 
“I do not know [if it will impact on my future]. 
“I do not want to think too much about what will happen, only training. 
“I have not had a chance to discuss the matter with my teammates.” NUFC transfers - the latest news
